links.title: Consumer Roundup: Department Stores Diverge, GameStop's Flash In The Pan, Disrupting Trends
links.description: A sizable portion of the consumer space, and the retail industry, in particular, has been partially disrupted by the fast expansion of pure e-commerce players with aggressive business models. You will not be surprised to know I am talking about Amazon ( AMZN) and other online retailers that replicate, at least in part, Amazon's business model.

links.title: How The GDPR's Data Portability Rules Could Affect Client Churn
links.description: Last month, the U.S. Justice Department was found to be investigating AT&T Inc. (NYSE: T) and Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE: VZ) for allegedly colluding to lock customers into their networks and prevent server switches. This month, new policies in the European Union will make data transfers even simpler than they were before, meaning the churn companies feared under old rules could now accelerate.

messages.body: $AAPL CLOSES BELOW ITS OPENING PRICE UNABLE TO HOLD EARLY SESSION GAINS: https://techniquant.com/reports/stock-aapl-daily-technical-report-for-2018-05-21/

links.title: AAPL closes below its opening price unable to hold early session gains
links.description: Highlights Overview AAPL ended Monday at 187.63 gaining $1.32 (0.71%) on low volume. Trading $1.27 higher after the open, Apple was unable to hold its gains as the bears took control ending the day below its opening price. Closing within the prior day's range, prices failed to decisively move past the previous day's trading range in a lackluster session.
